Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base and convex sides, low neck with everted rolled lip, and two pie-crust ‘wavy’ handles on the shoulder. Body slightly warped in the firing process.
Curator's comments: Like Wavy-handled W14 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair; Hole worn through at base, interior corroded; white deposit on both interior and exterior.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
